headline: Warren Buffett's Resounding Message to Wall Street, Delivered Over a Number of Years, Couldn't Be Clearer. And It May Change the Way You Invest Right Now.
summary: Investors look to Warren Buffett for guidance because he's proven he can weather any market storm.  A recent example: Buffett sold positions in S&P 500 index funds in the fourth quarter, locking in gains before the benchmark went on to decline.

headline: Is Oracle Stock a Buy Now?
summary: At first blush, some investors might overlook this throwback tech stock, assuming that it wouldn't have performed well in the age of artificial intelligence (AI).  Not only has it outperformed the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite handily, it has also outpaced some of the most prominent stocks within those indexes.  As of this writing, its shares have generated a total return of 34% over the last three years -- more or less matching the total returns of both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite.

headline: 'Cyclical headwinds' are developing for the tech trade
summary: Wall Street strategists are revising their S&P forecasts, yet the outlook for the "Magnificent Seven" remains largely overlooked. T. Rowe Price science and technology equity strategy portfolio manager Tony Wang joins Morning Brief to discuss the future of the tech trade and the impact of artificial intelligence (AI)–driven investments on stock performance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: A Market Downturn Creates a Perfect Entry Point for This Promising AI Player
summary: When it comes to AI stocks, Nvidia is king.  Nearly every AI technology relies on heavy training and distributed computing power to function.  In areas like data centers -- crucial infrastructure that makes the AI revolution possible -- its market share is even higher.

headline: Better Artificial Intelligence Stock: SoundHound AI vs. Cerence AI
summary: At a market cap of $4 billion, the company is essentially still a small-cap stock with plenty of room for future growth.  Investors considering buying shares of SoundHound might also be interested in Cerence (NASDAQ: CRNC), a competitor that is even smaller with a market cap of around $400 million.  After 10 years of innovation and research, SoundHound launched its Houndify platform in 2016.

headline: Nvidia Has 81% of Its $304 Million Stock Portfolio Invested in 3 Groundbreaking AI Stocks
summary: The semiconductor giant Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) is quite the company, developing high-end graphics processing units (GPUs) that help power artificial intelligence (AI) applications.  Many investors view Nvidia as the picks-and-shovels play for AI, which would be pretty remarkable given how much AI is expected to change nearly all aspects of our daily lives.  With a nearly $3 trillion market cap, Nvidia has grown so big that it has excess resources available to invest in other AI companies that it finds compelling or that it may partner or work with.

headline: 2 Stock-Split AI Stocks to Buy Before They Soar 85% and 105%, According to Certain Wall Street Analysts
summary: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) completed a 10-for-1 stock split in October 2024, and Arista Networks (NYSE: ANET) completed a 4-for-1 stock split in December 2024.  Ananda Baruah at Loop Capital recently raised the target price on Supermicro to $70 per share, which implies 105% upside from the current share price of $34.

headline: 2 Nasdaq Stocks I Would Buy if the Stock Market Plummets in 2025
summary: The Nasdaq Composite (NASDAQINDEX: ^IXIC) is down more than 7% year to date at the time of writing.  Sudden dips in the stock market are not fun, but they are common and can help you buy shares of quality growth stocks at better prices.  No one knows where the stock market is headed in 2025, but if it continues to fall, there are two growing companies I would buy in a heartbeat.
